concise_definition: adj. 瘦的, 薄的, 稀疏的; v. 变薄, 稀释

definitions.explanation_en: Having little thickness or diameter; not thick or fat in physical form.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在物理形态上厚度或直径很小，不厚或不胖。
definitions.example_en: The paper was so thin that you could see through it.
definitions.example_cn: 这张纸太薄了，几乎可以透光。

definitions.explanation_en: Of a person or animal: having little body fat or flesh; lean or underweight.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指人或动物体脂极少、肌肉瘦削，体重偏低。
definitions.example_en: She has been thin since she started her rigorous diet.
definitions.example_cn: 自从她开始严格节食以来，就一直很瘦。

definitions.explanation_en: Of a substance or population: not dense or abundant; sparse or weak in concentration or quantity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指物质或人群密度低、数量稀少，浓度或数量微弱。
definitions.example_en: The crowd was thin at the morning lecture.

definitions.explanation_en: To make or become thinner in thickness, density, or strength; to reduce the concentration or amount of something.
definitions.explanation_cn: 使某物变薄、密度降低或强度减弱；减少某物的浓度或数量。
definitions.example_en: The soup needs to be thinned with a little water.
definitions.example_cn: 这汤需要加点水稀释一下。

comparison.analysis: “Slim” (苗条的) 通常带有积极或审美的含义，形容身材匀称、优雅地瘦，常用于描述人。而 “thin” 更中性，有时甚至带有负面含义，如过度消瘦或营养不良。
“Fine” (纤细的) 可用于描述物体的细微结构，如细线、细丝，强调的是微观尺度上的纤细，常用于技术或艺术语境。而 “thin” 更通用，适用于宏观和日常语境，如薄纸、薄雾。
“Sparse” (稀疏的) 专指分布稀少、间隔大，常用于描述植被、人口或信息密度，强调空间上的不密集。而 “thin” 在描述数量时更泛化，可指浓度低、人数少或强度弱，适用范围更广。
